## Pipes

-   2014+ magrittr pipe `%>%`

-   2021+ (R $\geq$ 4.1.0) native R pipe `|>`

. . .

Isabella Vel√°squez's blog post [*Understanding the native R pipe*
\|\>](https://ivelasq.rbind.io/blog/understanding-the-r-pipe/) (2022)

<br>

. . .

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
```{r echo=TRUE, eval=FALSE}
do_something(arg1, arg2, arg3, ...)

arg1 |>  
  do_something(arg2, arg3)
```
:::

::: {.column width="5%"}
:::

::: {.column width="45%"}
```{r echo=TRUE, eval=FALSE}
mean(0:10)

0:10 |> 
  mean()
```
:::
:::

. . .

<br>

To change shortcut to the native pipe:

`Tools` ‚Üí `Global Options` ‚Üí `Code` ‚Üí `Editing` ‚Üí `Use Native Pipe Operator`

Windows: `Ctrl` + `Shift` + `M`

Mac: `Cmd` + `Shift` + `M`

## Namespacing

`package::function()`

`dplyr::select()`

. . .

-   tells R explicitly to use the function `select` from the package `dplyr`

-   helps avoid name conflicts (e.g., `MASS::select()`)

-   does not require `library(dplyr)`

. . .

::: columns
::: {.column width="45%"}
```{r echo=TRUE, eval=FALSE}
library(dplyr)

mtcars |>  
  select(mpg, cyl) 
```
:::

::: {.column width="5%"}
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
```{r echo=TRUE, eval=FALSE}
# library(dplyr) not needed

mtcars |>  
  dplyr::select(mpg, cyl) 
```
:::
:::
